articles.author: Alex Mead
articles.title: Toddler tears as the nation's children begin to receive COVID shots - New York Post
articles.description: The youngest American's began getting their COVID vaccines this week.
articles.content: Rooney Brown, 4, left, sits on the lap of her mom, Jessica, as she gets a COVID-19 vaccine from RN Megan Valente while at the same time Ansley Dinkler, 4, right, sits on the lap of her mom, Ayame, as… [+115 chars]

articles.author: Alistair MacDonald, Bojan Pancevski and Drew Hinshaw
articles.title: Russia Hits Grain Terminals in Latest Attack on Ukraine's Food Infrastructure - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Russian forces targeted at least two large North American-owned grain terminals in the port of Mykolaiv, as part of what Kyiv and Western governments say is a campaign to degrade Ukraine’s ability to export food.
articles.content:
• Attack on grain terminals deals another blow to Ukraines beleaguered food-export capabilities.
  • Crash of a drone allegedly controlled by Kyiv sparks fire at a large Russian refinery.

articles.author: Jenni Mortimer
articles.title: American country music star Luke Combs reveals All Blacks dream - New Zealand Herald
articles.description: Luke Combs was one try from rugby glory, but he traded it all for Crocs and a microphone.

articles.author: Bailey Schulz and Zach Wichter
articles.title: American Airlines will end service to four cities in September citing pilot shortage - Yahoo! Voices
articles.description: American Airlines will stop flying to Islip and Ithaca, New York; Toledo, Ohio; and Dubuque, Iowa, citing a lack of pilots
articles.content:
American Airlines will cut service to four cities because of a pilot shortage.
As of Sept. 7, the airline will no longer serve Islip or Ithaca in New York; Toledo, Ohio; or Dubuque, Iowa.
All four … [+3204 chars]
